text: Bosnia and Herzegovina will be competing at the 2020 Summer Paralympics in Tokyo, Japan, from 25 August to 6 September 2020. This will be their seventh consecutive appearance at the Summer Paralympics since 1996. ==Shooting== Bosnia and Herzegovina have qualified quotas for shooting. {|class=wikitable style="font-size:90%" |- !rowspan="2"|Athlete !rowspan="2"|Event !colspan="2"|Qualification !colspan="2"|Final |- !Score !Rank !Score !Rank |- align=center |align=left|Ervin Bejdic |align=left|Mixed 50 m pistol SH1 | | | | |- align=center |align=left|Zerina Skomorac |align=left|Mixed 10 m air rifle prone SH2 | | | | |} == Sitting Volleyball == The men's sitting volleyball team qualified for the 2020 Summer Paralympics after winning the silver medal at the 2018 World ParaVolley Championships. == See also == * Bosnia and Herzegovina at the Paralympics * Bosnia and Herzegovina at the 2020 Summer Olympics == References == Category:Nations at the 2020 Summer Paralympics 2020 Category:2020 in Bosnia and Herzegovina sport
title: Bosnia and Herzegovina at the 2020 Summer Paralympics
